data.title: What-Why Analysis of Expert Interviews: Analysing Geographically-Embedded Flow Data
data.affiliation:
Yang, YL (Corresponding Author), Monash Univ, Caulfield Sch Informat Technol, Clayton, Vic, Australia.
Yang, Yalong; Goodwin, Sarah, Monash Univ, Caulfield Sch Informat Technol, Clayton, Vic, Australia.
data.abstract: In this paper, we present our analysis of five expert interviews, each from a different application domain. Such analysis is crucial to understanding the real-world scenarios of analysing geographically-embedded flow data. The results of our analysis show that similar high-level tasks were conducted in different domains. To better describe the targets of these tasks, we proposed three flow-targets for analysing geographically-embedded flow data: single flow, total flow and regional flow.
data.keywords: Human-centered computing; Visualization; Visualization design and evaluation methods
